definitions: raised strip of ground forming a path or barrier along a road or waterway
flat strip of land alongside a road providing space for emergencies
examples: The berm prevented floodwater from reaching the residential area
Workers reinforced the canal berm after heavy rainfall
The truck pulled onto the grassy berm to check the flat tire
Emergency vehicles parked on the berm during the accident response

definitions: small juicy fruit containing seeds, typically growing on bushes or vines
examples: She picked fresh berries from the garden for breakfast
The birds feasted on berries throughout the autumn months

definitions: ancient Norse warrior who fought in a wild frenzy during battle
person who acts with uncontrolled violence or rage
examples: The berserker charged into battle wearing only bear skins
Viking berserkers were feared throughout medieval Europe
He went absolutely berserker when he discovered the damage
The protestor turned berserker and attacked the police barrier

definitions: fixed bunk or sleeping place on a ship or train
designated space at a dock where a ship can be moored
position or appointment, especially in sports teams or employment
examples: She booked a lower berth on the overnight train to Chicago
The sailors returned to their berths after the night watch
The cargo ship waited for an available berth at the port
The yacht secured a permanent berth at the marina
He earned a berth on the national team through hard work
She secured a berth in the prestigious law firm

definitions: transparent precious stone including emerald and aquamarine varieties with greenish or bluish colors
examples: The jeweler examined the pale green beryl under magnification
Aquamarine is actually a blue variety of beryl crystal

definitions: lightweight metallic element used in alloys and nuclear reactors, symbol Be, atomic number 4
examples: Beryllium copper alloys are used in specialized tools and instruments
The aerospace industry values beryllium for its strength and lightness

definitions: act of surrounding a place with armed forces to capture it or force surrender
examples: The besieging of the castle lasted for three months
Historical accounts describe the besieging of ancient cities

definitions: illegal sexual activity between a human and an animal
behavior showing extreme cruelty or lack of human decency
examples: Laws against bestiality exist in most countries worldwide
The court prosecuted the case as an act of bestiality
The bestiality of the massacre shocked the international community
Such bestiality has no place in civilized society

definitions: medieval illustrated book describing real and mythical animals with moral lessons
examples: The medieval bestiary depicted dragons alongside real animals
Scholars study bestiaries to understand medieval worldviews

definitions: book or other product that sells in very large numbers
examples: Her debut novel became an unexpected bestseller worldwide
The bookstore prominently displayed this week's bestsellers

definitions: money or something valuable risked on an uncertain outcome
informal prediction or confident opinion about something
examples: He placed a fifty dollar bet on the championship game
The casino limits the maximum bet at each table
My bet is that prices will rise next quarter
It's a safe bet she'll win the election

definitions: second letter of the Greek alphabet used in mathematics and science
preliminary version of software released for testing before final launch
second in rank, importance, or position in a hierarchy
examples: The beta coefficient measures stock volatility in finance
Scientists use beta particles to describe certain radiation
Users reported bugs found in the beta version of the app
The company invited testers to try the beta release
He served as the beta male in the wolf pack hierarchy
The beta team finished second in the competition

definitions: tropical Asian plant whose leaves are chewed with areca nut as a mild stimulant
examples: Betel leaves are traditionally offered at Indian weddings
The elderly woman chewed betel nut wrapped in betel leaves

definitions: act of being disloyal to someone who trusts you, breaking faith or confidence
examples: His betrayal of company secrets led to immediate termination
She never recovered from her best friend's betrayal

definitions: formal agreement or ceremony marking an engagement to be married
examples: The betrothal ceremony united two prominent families
Their betrothal was announced in the society pages

definitions: person who is formally engaged to be married to someone
examples: His betrothed wore the family heirloom engagement ring
The prince met his betrothed at the royal ball

definitions: act or process of making something better or improving a situation
examples: The foundation works for the betterment of education in rural areas
She dedicated her life to the betterment of society

definitions: sloping edge or surface cut at an angle other than ninety degrees
examples: The carpenter cut a bevel on the picture frame corners
The mirror featured an elegant bevel around its edges

definitions: any liquid suitable for drinking, especially other than water
examples: The restaurant offers a wide selection of hot and cold beverages
Alcoholic beverages are prohibited in this establishment

definitions: feeling of being completely confused or puzzled by something unexpected or complex
examples: She stared in bewilderment at the complicated instructions
His sudden resignation left the staff in complete bewilderment

definitions: grooved rim that holds a gemstone or watch crystal in place
outer frame edge of a device screen or display
examples: The diamond was secured in a platinum bezel setting
The watchmaker carefully replaced the bezel around the crystal
The smartphone features a thin bezel for maximum screen space
Monitor bezels have become increasingly narrow over the years

definitions: cloth or plastic worn under a baby's chin to protect clothing while eating
numbered cloth worn on chest or back to identify athletes in competitions
examples: The baby's bib was covered with mashed carrots and peas
She tied the bib around her toddler's neck before lunch
Marathon runners pinned their race bibs to their shirts
His bib number was 42 in the cycling competition

definitions: sacred book of Christianity containing Old and New Testaments
book regarded as the definitive guide or authority on a subject
examples: She reads passages from the Bible every morning
The hotel room contained a Gideon Bible in the drawer
This cookbook is considered the bible of French cuisine
The style manual became the bible for newspaper editors

definitions: person who compiles lists of books and writings on particular subjects or by specific authors
examples: The bibliographer catalogued all known works by Shakespeare
University bibliographers maintain comprehensive academic databases

definitions: list of books, articles, and sources used or referenced in scholarly work
examples: The thesis included a twenty-page bibliography of sources
Students must cite all references in their bibliography

definitions: person who loves and collects books, especially rare or unusual editions
examples: The bibliophile spent weekends browsing antiquarian bookshops
Her bibliophile friend owned thousands of first editions

definitions: salt containing the bicarbonate ion, commonly sodium bicarbonate used in baking and medicine
examples: She added bicarbonate to the cake batter for leavening
The doctor prescribed bicarbonate for his acid reflux

definitions: two hundredth anniversary of an important event or founding
examples: The nation celebrated its bicentenary with parades and fireworks
The university's bicentenary featured special academic conferences

definitions: relating to or marking a two hundredth anniversary celebration
examples: America's bicentennial in 1976 featured nationwide festivities
The city planned bicentennial events throughout the year

definitions: large muscle at the front of the upper arm that flexes the elbow and rotates the forearm
examples: He flexed his biceps to show his gym progress
The weightlifter's biceps bulged as she lifted the barbell

definitions: continuous petty arguing or quarreling about trivial matters
examples: The siblings' constant bicker annoyed their parents
Their bicker over household chores never seemed to end

definitions: continuous arguing about unimportant matters in an annoying way
examples: The committee's bickering prevented any real progress
Their constant bickering strained the family gathering

definitions: vehicle with two wheels powered by pedaling, with handlebars for steering
examples: She rode her bicycle to work every morning
The child learned to balance on a bicycle without training wheels

definitions: activity or sport of riding bicycles for transportation, exercise, or recreation
examples: Bicycling through the countryside offers scenic views
Regular bicycling improves cardiovascular health significantly

definitions: offer of a price for something at an auction or sale
attempt or effort to achieve or obtain something
formal proposal to undertake work or supply goods at stated price
examples: Her bid of five hundred dollars won the antique vase
The auctioneer called for higher bids from the floor
The city's bid to host the Olympics was successful
His bid for reelection failed by a narrow margin
The construction company submitted a bid for the new bridge
Several firms placed bids for the government contract

definitions: person who offers to pay a particular amount for something at an auction or tender
examples: The highest bidder took home the rare painting
Several bidders competed for the beachfront property

definitions: process of making bids at an auction or for a contract
command, order, or request from someone in authority
examples: The bidding started at one thousand dollars
Competitive bidding drove the price beyond expectations
She left immediately at her boss's bidding
The servants carried out the king's bidding

definitions: event that occurs every two years or lasts for two years
plant that completes its life cycle in two years
examples: The art biennial attracts international artists and collectors
The conference operates on a biennial schedule
Carrots are biennial plants that flower in their second year
The gardener planted biennial flowers for next year's bloom

definitions: movable frame or stand on which a coffin or corpse is placed before burial
examples: Pallbearers carried the bier into the church for the service
The flower-covered bier stood at the front of the chapel

definitions: division of something into two branches or parts, especially in roads, rivers, or decisions
examples: The river's bifurcation created two distinct waterways
The company faced a bifurcation between growth and stability

definitions: crime of marrying someone while already legally married to another person
examples: He was charged with bigamy after his first wife discovered the second marriage
Bigamy is a felony offense in most jurisdictions

definitions: wild sheep native to North American mountains with large curved horns
examples: Bighorn sheep navigate steep rocky cliffs with ease
The male bighorn's horns can weigh up to thirty pounds

definitions: curve or recess in a coastline forming a bay
loop or slack part in a rope
examples: Ships anchored in the sheltered bight during the storm
The Great Australian Bight stretches along the southern coast
The sailor created a bight in the rope for the mooring
Never step into a bight of rope on deck

definitions: person who is intolerant toward those holding different opinions, especially regarding race or religion
examples: The bigot refused to hire anyone from certain ethnic backgrounds
Don't be a bigot; respect different viewpoints and cultures

definitions: intolerance toward those who hold different opinions from oneself, especially regarding race, religion, or politics
examples: The organization fights against bigotry in all its forms
Religious bigotry has caused countless conflicts throughout history

definitions: informal term for bicycle or motorcycle used for transportation or recreation
examples: She commutes to work on her bike every day
The motorcycle club rode their bikes across the country

definitions: person who rides a bicycle, especially as a sport or hobby
person who rides a motorcycle, often as part of a group or culture
examples: The mountain biker navigated the challenging trail expertly
Professional bikers train for hours every day
The leather-clad biker roared down the highway
Bikers gathered at the annual motorcycle rally

definitions: women's two-piece swimsuit with separate top and bottom portions
examples: She packed several bikinis for her beach vacation
The boutique displayed colorful bikinis in the window

definitions: bitter yellowish fluid produced by the liver to aid digestion
angry and bitter verbal attacks or feelings
examples: The gallbladder stores bile produced by the liver
Bile helps break down fats during digestion
His speech was full of bile directed at his opponents
She couldn't hide the bile in her voice

definitions: lowest part of a ship's hull where water collects
worthless nonsense or stupid talk
examples: The crew pumped water from the bilge after the storm
Oil accumulated in the ship's bilge over time
Don't believe that bilge about instant wealth schemes
He talked absolute bilge at the meeting
